intro: Restiaria crispa, commonly known as the curly restia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the grass family (Poaceae) and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, greenish-white flowers. Restiaria crispa is often found in sandy or rocky soils, typically in coastal or inland areas. It is a low-growing plant that thrives in full sun and is well adapted to arid environments.
